title: Associations between Dietary Phenolic Compounds and Biomarkers of Atrial Fibrillation Risk in Adults with Metabolic Syndrome: A Longitudinal Analysis.
abstract: Phenolic compounds (PCs) may reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease due to their anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Examining relationships between dietary intake of total PC and atrial fibrillation (AF) risk biomarkers in a Mediterranean population with metabolic syndrome may offer new insights about AF physiopathology.
